tip.title: Clear Around Vents
tip.description: Furniture, carpets and other objects can block vents and prevent heated or cooled air from traveling. This blockage makes your heating or cooling system work harder and prevents rooms from warming up or cooling down quickly. If you have forced air in your home, check to see that your air vents have sufficient room to breathe.

tip.title: Let Your Heaters Breathe
tip.description: Don't smother your heaters. Make sure the warm air they produce can circulate around the room by moving any furniture or objects that are in the way. Otherwise, you'll end up paying more for energy while still feeling chilly.

tip.title: New Year, New You
tip.description: Start the new year off right by talking with your friends and families about energy savings! Whether it's hitting the gym or weatherizing your windows, accountability makes all the difference. Plus - you'll learn from each others' trials and triumphs.

tip.title: Catch Some Rays
tip.description: Yes, you can bask in the sunlight even when it's cold outside. Warm your home with sunny rays by opening your blinds during winter days. You'll save energy - and money!

quiz.question: Which appliance do you think uses the most energy?
quiz.answerDescription: Clothes dryers use more energy than any other appliance.
